title: Educational: What is ENR?
content:
Most ask "what's approval probability?"

I ask "what's my expected NET return after IV crush, theta decay, and asymmetric payoffs?"

That's ENR. Here's how it works üßµ

#biotech #optionstrading #FDA #PDUFA
thread_parts:
1/ A drug can have 85% approval odds but TERRIBLE options.

Why? Market priced it in. IV juiced. Premiums insane.

ENR = probability √ó payoff - premium - IV crush

2/ I run 10K Monte Carlo sims per strike:

‚Ä¢ Approval/rejection odds
‚Ä¢ Stock move magnitude
‚Ä¢ IV crush (50-70% for binary events)
‚Ä¢ Time decay

Then average them all.

3/ My threshold: 140% ENR minimum.

I expect to 2x+ on average across thousands of similar trades.

Below 140%? I pass. Even if thesis is great.

Math over hype.

4/ See ENR in action at powersbiostrikes.com

Every trade shows:
‚Ä¢ Entry price
‚Ä¢ ENR at entry
‚Ä¢ Win probability
‚Ä¢ Full thesis

100% transparent.

#biotech #optionstrading #FDA

title: Educational: CONT Score Explained
content:
"Buy the rumor, sell the news" kills biotech traders.

Drug APPROVED and stock drops?

I built CONT score to predict which approvals RUN vs get dumped üßµ

#biotech #optionstrading #FDA #PDUFA
thread_parts:
1/ CONT predicts post-catalyst action.

Drives continuation:
‚úÖ First-in-class
‚úÖ Unmet medical need
‚úÖ Orphan status
‚úÖ Multiple catalysts
‚úÖ Price momentum into event

2/ Kills continuation:
‚ùå Priced in (ran 100%+)
‚ùå Me-too drug
‚ùå Single indication
‚ùå Insider selling

I weight each factor ‚Üí 0-100 score.

3/ Score guide:

80+ = HOLD through catalyst
50-79 = Tight exit (take profits quick)
<50 = Exit BEFORE catalyst

Saved me from multiple "approval dumps."

4/ $CRMD has CONT score of 90.

Why? Profitable, 21% short interest, orphan drug, multiple indications.

"Hold through" setup, not "sell the news" trap.
